title: The Swad Restaurant – Full-Stack Restaurant App

requirements.text: Apply a premium warm-color visual theme throughout the app using saffron (#F28C28), maroon (#800000), and gold (#FFD700) as primary brand colors. Use rich dark backgrounds for contrast, elegant serif or semi-serif typography for headings, and subtle texture or pattern accents inspired by Indian motifs. Ensure consistent spacing, smooth transitions, and a clean layout that feels premium and easy to navigate.

quotes: warm colors like saffron, maroon, and gold
premium, clean, and easy to navigate

acceptanceCriteria: Saffron, maroon, and gold are used as the dominant palette across all screens
Typography is elegant and consistent across headings and body text
All transitions and page changes have smooth animations
Layout is responsive and usable on both mobile and desktop viewports

requirements.text: Create a Splash Screen as the initial landing view that displays the restaurant logo image, the restaurant name 'The Swad Restaurant', and the tagline 'Experience the True Taste of Swad'. The screen should auto-dismiss after ~2.5 seconds and navigate to the Home screen with a fade-out animation.

quotes: Tagline: 'Experience the True Taste of Swad'

acceptanceCriteria: Splash screen is shown on first load
Logo, restaurant name, and tagline are all visible
Screen fades out after ~2.5 seconds and transitions to Home

requirements.text: Build a Home screen that displays: (1) a hero banner section with a featured dish image and a welcome message, (2) a 'Today's Special / Special Offers' horizontal scroll section with dish cards, (3) three prominent quick-action buttons: 'Order Now', 'Book Table', and 'View Menu', each navigating to their respective sections.

quotes: Quick buttons: Order Now, Book Table, View Menu

acceptanceCriteria: Hero banner with featured dish image is visible
Today's Special section renders scrollable dish cards
Order Now, Book Table, and View Menu buttons navigate to the correct pages

requirements.text: Store featured dishes and today's specials in the backend. Each dish record must include: name, description, price, category (Starters, Main Course, Breads, Desserts, Beverages), image URL, veg/non-veg flag, and availability status. Expose query functions to retrieve all dishes, filter by category, and filter by veg/non-veg.

quotes: Categories: Starters, Main Course, Breads, Desserts, Beverages
Item name, description, price, and image

acceptanceCriteria: Dishes can be stored with all required fields
Query returns dishes filtered by category
Query returns dishes filtered by veg/non-veg flag
Dishes are seeded with sample data for all five categories

requirements.text: Build a Menu screen with tab-based category navigation (Starters, Main Course, Breads, Desserts, Beverages) and a Veg / Non-Veg toggle filter. Each menu item card must display the dish image, name, description, price, a veg/non-veg indicator dot (green/red), and an 'Add to Cart' button with quantity controls (+ / -).

quotes: Item name, description, price, and image

acceptanceCriteria: All five category tabs are visible and switch the displayed items
Veg/Non-Veg filter correctly hides/shows items
Each card shows image, name, description, price, and dietary indicator
Add to Cart button adds the item to the cart and shows quantity controls

requirements.text: Implement a persistent shopping cart (stored in frontend React state / local context). The Cart screen must display all added items with names, quantities, prices, and a subtotal. Users must be able to: adjust item quantities, remove items, enter a coupon code (validated against backend), and see the final total. Provide placeholder payment method selection: UPI, Card, and Cash on Delivery. On order confirmation, save the order to the backend.

quotes: Multiple payment options (UPI, Card, Cash on Delivery)

acceptanceCriteria: Cart persists across navigation within the session
Quantity can be increased or decreased per item
Coupon code field is present and validates against backend coupons
Payment method selector shows UPI, Card, and Cash on Delivery options
Placing order saves order record to backend and clears cart

requirements.text: Store orders and coupon codes in the backend. An order record must include: items (name, quantity, price), total amount, payment method, user reference, order status (Pending, Confirmed, Preparing, Delivered), and timestamp. Coupon records must include a code string and discount percentage. Expose update functions for order status.
acceptanceCriteria: Orders are stored with all required fields
Coupons can be created and queried by code string
Order status can be updated via a backend call
Sample coupon codes are seeded (e.g., SWAD10 for 10% off)

requirements.text: Build a Table Reservation screen with a booking form containing fields: Name, Phone Number, Date, Time, and Number of Guests. On submission, save the reservation to the backend and show a confirmation message. Display existing reservations in the user's account section.

quotes: Booking form (Name, Phone, Date, Time, Number of Guests)

acceptanceCriteria: Form has all five required fields with validation
Submitted reservation is saved to the backend
Confirmation message is displayed after successful booking
Reservations are retrievable per user

requirements.text: Implement user account functionality using Internet Identity for authentication. After login, show the user's profile page with: order history (list of past orders with status), saved delivery addresses (add/remove), and table reservation history. Guest users can browse and add to cart but must log in before placing an order.
acceptanceCriteria: Internet Identity login flow works and returns a principal
Order history lists past orders with name, date, total, and status
User can add and remove saved delivery addresses
Unauthenticated users are prompted to log in before checkout

requirements.text: Build a Reviews & Ratings screen where authenticated users can submit a star rating (1–5) and a text review for their dining/ordering experience. Display all reviews in a list with reviewer name (or anonymous), rating stars, review text, and date. Store reviews in the backend.

quotes: Customers can give feedback and ratings

acceptanceCriteria: Authenticated users can submit a rating and review
Reviews are saved to the backend with timestamp
All reviews are displayed in a scrollable list
Star rating visually renders as filled/empty stars

requirements.text: Build a Contact & Location page that displays: the restaurant's address, opening hours (e.g., Mon–Sun 11am–11pm), a static embedded Google Maps iframe for the restaurant location, a 'Call Us' button (tel: link), a 'WhatsApp' button (wa.me link), and an email address.
acceptanceCriteria: Address and opening hours are displayed
A Google Maps embed iframe shows the restaurant location
Call button opens the phone dialer with the restaurant number
WhatsApp button opens a WhatsApp chat link
Page is accessible from the main navigation

requirements.text: Build an Admin Panel page (protected by a hardcoded admin principal check in the backend). The admin panel must include three tabs: (1) Menu Management – add, edit, and delete dish records including uploading an image URL; (2) Order Management – view all orders, update order status; (3) Revenue Reports – display total orders count, total revenue, and a simple list of orders grouped by day.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin panel is only accessible to the designated admin principal
Admin can create, edit, and delete menu items
Admin can view all orders and change their status
Revenue report tab shows total revenue and order counts
Non-admin users see an access-denied message

requirements.text: Generate and use custom images as static assets for: the restaurant logo (used on splash screen and nav), a hero banner for the Home screen, and representative dish images for each of the five menu categories.
acceptanceCriteria: Logo image is rendered on the splash screen and in the top navigation
Hero banner image is displayed on the Home screen
Each menu category has at least one representative dish image rendered from static assets

constraints: Authentication must use Internet Identity only — no third-party OAuth providers
All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo)
No external databases — all data stored in Motoko stable variables
No real payment processing — payment method selection is UI-only with placeholder confirmation
No real push notification service — notification UI should be simulated/static
No WhatsApp or Google Maps API keys required — use static href links and iframe embeds
Frontend immutable paths must not be modified
nonGoals: Native Android or iOS app packaging (React web app only)
Actual payment gateway integration (Stripe, Razorpay, etc.)
